meanings.definition: Lack of belief or faith in something.
meanings.sent1: Her nonbeliefs in ghosts made her unafraid of the old house.
meanings.sent2: His nonbeliefs in luck led him to rely on hard work instead.
meanings.sent3: Despite his nonbeliefs in aliens, he jokingly wore a tinfoil hat.
meanings.sent4: The nonbeliefs in magic were shattered when the magician made the elephant disappear.
meanings.sent5: The nonbeliefs in Santa Claus were challenged when presents appeared under the tree.

meanings.definition: Refusal or rejection to believe in something.
meanings.sent1: Their nonbeliefs in superstitions made them break mirrors without worry.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's nonbeliefs in pseudoscience guided her research choices.
meanings.sent3: His nonbeliefs in jinxes led him to walk under ladders for fun.
meanings.sent4: The nonbeliefs in conspiracy theories protected her from falling into misinformation.
meanings.sent5: Their nonbeliefs in urban legends kept them from being scared of the dark.
